column2: At Ducon Infratechnologies Ltd., we take pride in our dynamic work environment and commitment to excellence. column2: WHITE GLOBE PRIVATE LIMITED is looking for Quality Check to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     Quality Control Procedures: Developing and implementing quality control procedures, protocols, and standards to meet industry and regulatory requirements     Process Monitoring: Continuously monitoring and assessing production or service delivery processes to identify areas where improvements can be made to enhance quality     Data Collection and Analysis: Collecting and analyzing data related to quality metrics, defect rates, and performance to identify trends, areas of concern, and opportunities for improvement     Root Cause Analysis: Investigating quality issues, defects, and non-conformances to determine the root causes and develop corrective and preventive actions     Quality Inspections: Conducting inspections and audits of products, services, or processes to ensure they meet the established quality standards     Documentation: Maintaining detailed records and documentation related to quality control procedures, inspections, and audits     Quality Training: Providing training and guidance to employees and teams on quality control best practices and procedures     Collaboration: Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including production, engineering, and supply chain, to implement quality improvement initiatives     Regulatory Compliance: Ensuring that quality processes and procedures comply with industry-specific regulations and standards     Continuous Improvement: Participating in and driving continuous improvement initiatives to enhance quality control processes and overall product or service quality

column2: Quality Assurance Team Lead India, Delhi NCR What were looking for: As Quality Assurance Team Lead at Tide for India business, you will be managing and leading a team of Quality analysts across operational processes like KYC, Ongoing Monitoring, Member Support and Member Success team. This includes managing their day-to-day activity and taking responsibility for their personal development, whilst managing the overall workload of the team. You will also provide management Information to the senior management where necessary. You would be working on the optimization of processes including working on new ideas, solutions and partnerships. You need to ensure proper daily/weekly/monthly reporting and QA calibration sessions with the TLs/ managers of the respective teams. The outcome of these calibrations would be to identify procedural gaps as well as team and personal trends that can be improved. You will be collaborating with Quality Control and training team to perform monthly in-depth training needs analysis and identify opportunities for additional courses. Your team will also be conducting individual feedback sessions for each analyst to help them improve their knowledge. You will be handling disputes raised by Operations team over audits. You will be working on creating new scorecards and quality parameters. Some of the things youll be doing:? Guiding and developing a team of quality analysts; responsible for the overall performance management, coordination and evaluation of the team. Passionately participate in and drive the continuous improvement through ??aizen??and lean projects. Improving the QA scorecards to capture all new processes and procedures Making crucial decisions about compliance and other mistakes done by the analysts Ensuring timely reporting of QA metrics ??daily, weekly & monthly Leading calibration sessions, discussing the QA monthly analyst scorecards with TLs and managers Identifying process improvements and learning gaps. Management of agents and all aspects related to their tasks - assisting them with difficult cases and providing guidance where necessary Assigning tasks including daily organisation of the workload. Mentoring employees, monitoring their progress, goals, and removing blockers that prevent them from performing well. Providing guidance and support to agents with their long-term career journey at Tide.? Analysing data and spotting patterns on the basis of audits conducted.? Schedule creation and organisation, a variety of planning tasks. Liaison between different departments and team leads of other teams - coordinating across different business areas to achieve a common goal.? Participation in the recruitment process and acquisition of new staff in Quality Assurance. You??l be a great fit if:? You??e have at least 3 - 6 years in a team leading role with quality assurance.? Demonstrated ability to build, develop and handle a group of people Proven ability to solve problems creatively and ability to handle complex and ambiguous scenarios Demonstrated ability in multi- project management Ability to effectively and efficiently complete difficult goals or assignments Strong in data interpretation and audit Can adapt well to changing circumstances and strategy Ability to organize, prioritize and schedule work assignments Ability to make administrative and procedural judgements Demonstrated ability to handle reporting and analysis You are a subject matter expert, providing ongoing mentoring and continuous knowledge sharing with the team You are willing to work closely with our second line of defence (Risk and Compliance) to ensure we meet policies and regulatory requirements You have excellent communication & interpersonal skills and ability to work with varying stakeholders, both technical team members and business users Project Management & knowledge of Six Sigma/Lean Processes Experience in Fintech preferred Bachelors degree + MBA or equivalent degree from a premier institute is preferred What you??l get in return: Competitive salary Self & Family Health Insurance Term & Life Insurance OPD Benefits Mental wellbeing through Plumm Learning & Development Budget 15 days of Privilege leaves 12 days of Casual leaves 12 days of Sick leaves 3 paid days off for volunteering or L&D activities Stock Options Tide is a place for everyone At Tide, we believe that we can only succeed if we let our differences enrich our culture. Our Tideans come from a variety of backgrounds and experience levels. We consider everyone irrespective of their ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, veteran, neurodiversity or differently-abled status. We celebrate diversity in our workforce as a cornerstone of our success. Our commitment to a broad spectrum of ideas and backgrounds is what enables us to build products that resonate with our members??diverse needs and lives.? We are One Team and foster a transparent and inclusive environment, where everyone?? voice is heard. Role & responsibilities   Preferred candidate profile   Perks and benefits

column2: JOB   DESCRIPTION JOB   TITLE:   Peer   Review   Associate  DEPARTMENT:   Peer   Review Global   Services   Division REPORTS   TO:   Peer   Review   Supervisor,   Global   Services   Division,   SAGE   India Job   Purpose: 1. Check submitted manuscripts in through SAGE Track by ensuring that they conform  to the submission criteria and are ready for the peer review process. 2. Invite, assign, and assist reviewers who need to complete their reviews through  SAGE Track. 3. Follow up with editors, associate editors (if applicable), reviewers and authors who  have not completed their tasks by the deadline defined in SAGE Track. 4. Ensure that authors of accepted manuscripts complete and submit the electronic  contributor form through SAGE Track. 5. Check accepted manuscripts to ensure that all the necessary components are  present and ready for the SAGE Production team prior to export. This includes, but  is not limited to, checking manuscripts to ensure that author contact information is up  to date, all files are in an editable electronic format, permissions for copyrighted  material are collected, and references conform to the appropriate style (APA,  Chicago, ASA, AMA, CSE, etc.). 6. Export accepted manuscripts from SAGE Track to the SAGE Production Editor no  later than the article deadlines, as defined by the SAGE Production Editor. 7. Respond to queries from journal editors, associate editors (if applicable), authors,  reviewers, and SAGE staff. 8. Maintain the SAGE Track email templates and periodically update the email  templates to suit the needs of the individual journal. 9. On those of your journals with Editorial Assistant support, you will be responsible  for the overall peer review health of the journal including troubleshooting on the  sites, managing editor relationships (both Journal Editors and Associate Editors  where applicable), follow-ups with various constituents, providing guidance to the  Editorial Assistant, and be a first point of escalation for the Editorial Assistant?? queries.  Filling up and maintaining the Daily Tracker for all tasks that you are working on. 10.E-mail the PRA user performance report each week to the Peer review Supervisor  and the US Manager. 11.Periodically run reports out of SAGE Track. 12.Ensuring that the overdue task report that the PRS circulates is populated with the  comments for your journals each week before the meeting. 13.Troubleshoot to ensure that each SAGE Track site is functioning properly. 14.Keep SAGE Track sites up-to-date and in line with global initiatives and standards. 15.Work with US and UK staff to implement selected sites that are not already live. Key   Accountabilities: Productivity   Standards: 1. Handle submissions based on the numbers mentioned in the yearly WAP following the successful completion of your training, which will be transitioned to you in a phased manner. 2. Respond to any email inquiries from journal editors, associate editors (if applicable), authors, reviewers, and other SAGE staff within 24 hours of receipt (excluding weekends and holidays only), and respond in a clear, articulate, and organized manner. 3. Occasional correspondence with the support staff at ScholarOne may be necessary to troubleshoot issues within SAGE Track. 4. Assist the journal editor and/or SAGE staff with any projects or initiatives, as requested. 5. Act as point of contact between the individual journal editors and SAGE to communicate updates, information, and progress pertaining to the peer review process. 6. Communicate Editorial Board updates to the appropriate SAGE Global Publishing Editor and Production Editor.7. Refer to and adhere to the Journal Editor?? Guide for assigned journals Act   as   a   Liaison   Between   SAGE   and   Journal   Editors: 1. Communicate in a professional and personable manner with editors, associate  editors (if applicable), authors, reviewers, and other SAGE staff on any issues  concerning their journal. 2. Problem solve on issues involving the journal as required. 3. Closely monitor manuscript progress as manuscripts move through the steps of the  peer-review process. 4. Please forward your supervisor any communication that you receive from  editors/authors that is tense or volatile in nature, also, please feel free to send your  supervisor any positive words and praise you receive from editors and authors. SKILLS This includes, but is not limited to, the following: 1. Contribute ideas and give feedback in a concise and productive way 2. Be available to provide support to peer review team members on select journals as  needed and defined by your supervisor 3. Participate in projects, committees, or task forces as assigned by departmental  supervisor 4. Willingly contributes work and efforts to achieve group success. Participates actively  in team decision making. Works well with other team members and does not  contribute to unproductive group conflict 5. Communicate effectively with all; helpful and cooperative; should be courteous and  disciplined (work). 6. Engage in other activities, as needed, to achieve company and department goals   QUALIFICATIONS   &   EXPERIENCE Bachelor??   Degree. 1-2   years   relevant   experience   in   Publishing   Industry.

Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Research & Development, Product Management, and Marketing, to support product development initiatives and optimize product performance. 7. Quality Assurance: Implement quality assurance processes to ensure that field trials are conducted according to established protocols and regulatory requirements. 8. Documentation and Reporting: Prepare comprehensive reports and presentations summarizing experimental results, insights, and recommendations for internal stakeholders and external partners. 9. Budget Management: Manage the budget for the Grow Out Test program, including forecasting expenses, tracking spending, and optimizing resource allocation. 10. Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvement and innovation within the Grow Out Test program, driving efficiencies and enhancing productivity. column2: Job   Description: Quality   Manager   :   Irrigation   Project Profile   Summary:  A Quality Manager is responsible for ensuring that products or services meet the established standards of quality, safety, and reliability. Their role encompasses various tasks, including developing and implementing quality assurance procedures, conducting audits, analyzing data to identify areas for improvement, and collaborating with different departments to address quality issues. Responsibilities: 1. Develop and implement comprehensive quality management plans and procedures tailored to the unique requirements of the irrigation project, encompassing all phases of construction, installation, and commissioning. 2. Lead and supervise a team of quality professionals, providing guidance, training, and support to ensure the effective implementation of quality assurance and quality control activities on site. 3. Collaborate with project managers, engineers, subcontractors, and suppliers to establish quality requirements, specifications, and acceptance criteria for materials, equipment, and construction activities related to the irrigation system. 4. Conduct regular quality inspections, audits, and reviews of site activities to verify compliance with project specifications, drawings, and contractual requirements, identifying and addressing any non-conformities or deviations promptly. 5. Implement robust quality control measures to monitor and verify the quality of workmanship, materials, and installations, ensuring adherence to applicable codes, standards, and regulatory requirements. 6. Develop and maintain quality documentation, including quality plans, inspection reports, test records, and non-conformance reports, ensuring accuracy, completeness, and traceability of quality-related information. 7. Lead investigations into quality incidents, defects, or deficiencies, conducting root cause analysis and implementing corrective and preventive actions to address underlying issues and prevent recurrence. 8. Coordinate with external quality assurance and certification bodies as required to obtain necessary approvals, certifications, and compliance documentation for the irrigation project. 9. Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and quality metrics to track project quality performance, analyze trends, and identify opportunities for improvement, reporting findings to project stakeholders and management. 10. Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance project quality, efficiency, and effectiveness, collaborating with project teams to implement best practices, lessons learned, and innovative solution   Requirements: 1. Bachelor's degree BE in civil engineering, Construction Management . 2. Proficiency in project management software (e.g., Primavera P6, Microsoft Project) and Microsoft Office Suite. 3. Strong analytical skills and attention to detail, with the ability to interpret technical data and make informed decisions. 4. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively engage with diverse stakeholders. 5. Knowledge of irrigation systems, hydraulics, and water management principles. 6. Familiarity with relevant regulations, standards, and best practices in the irrigation industry. 7. Leadership qualities with a proven track record of successfully leading teams and delivering projects on time and within budget. Project   details: 1. Company Headquarter: Nagpur 2. Company: Infratech Construction Company 3. Project Name: Jigaon Project 4. Site location: Tal. Nandura, Dist.Buldana. Construction of Earthen Dam including spillway stilling basin, divide wall approach road, tail channel of Jigaon Project.

column2: Are you looking to make a real difference on a global scale        As a Senior Associate in C-Quest Capital's Carbon and Sustainability Accounting Team (CSAT), Quality Control,          you will have the opportunity to work on developing systems, procedures, and standards to maintain a certain level of quality in documentation being submitted to VERRA, GS and other GHG mechanisms                              The Carbon and Sustainability Accounting Team (CSAT),        is responsible for all aspects of carbon and sustainability accounting and compliance management for CQC s growing portfolio of projects, which currently number more than 90 projects and growing        CQC is active in a number of different carbon verticals in both reductions and avoidance including household devices, fuel switching, industrial energy efficiency, renewable energy, avoided methane emissions and methane capture and use, as well as nature-based carbon credits, including, but not limited to those associated with bamboo afforestation, restoration forestry, farmer managed natural restoration, assisted natural restoration, other forms of regenerative agriculture and sustainable forestry management and soil carbon accumulation               Key Responsibilities:                          Provide technical support in preparation of checklists/ templates for validation and verification activities under various GHG mechanisms with respect to the guidelines outlined under the GHG crediting program.          Perform thorough review and keep track of recent changes / developments in GHG mechanisms, which may impact our present and future project validation and verification.          Perform quality checks by accurately reviewing initial draft versions as well as final submissions packages to various GHG mechanisms and provide feedback for improving the quality of submission documents to respective Team leads.          Provide summarized report(s) / updates to all CSAT team members on periodic basis for respective GHG mechanisms.          Assisting in development/ updating the data collection tools such as developing questionnaires designed to understand baseline scenarios and monitoring project activities based on latest guidelines/applicable standards.          The successful candidate must have experience working in a carbon/ climate change domain.                  Prior experience would include                  2+ years of direct working experience on GHG mechanisms (VCS / CDM / GS/ SD Vista etc) .            In-depth understanding of various GHG crediting programs such as the Clean Development Mechanism (CDM), Verified Carbon Standard (VCS), SD VISta, Gold Standard, Article 6 of Paris Agreement etc            Strong attention to detail, analytical skills, and problem-solving aptitude are desirable.          Direct GHG Auditing experience under any GHG mechanism with emphasis on quality control is a plus.            A master s degree in the field of energy and/or environment, engineering is required.                Key Skills/Abilities:                          Strong project management skills, including the ability to prioritize and deliver efficiently and effectively under deadlines.          Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills and the ability to articulate their communications when reporting/representing data clearly and concisely.          An ability to fit in with the high-performance and collaborative culture of CQC.          An ability to self-manage day to day activities.            Able to work well in culturally diverse environment.                    Travel    :          The expectation is that the Senior Associate will make occasional trips to the operating regions (on need basis), but the majority of the time this will be New Delhi office based

column2: Do you thrive to help ship awesome software, not just prevent poor software from being released? At TestVagrant we believe that shipping awesome software requires more than just testing and test automation. It involves constant improvements to processes, tools, testing techniques, and approaches. It involves collaborating with engineering & business teams, collecting metrics, analyzing data, and innovating constantly. If you're someone who champions & advocates quality, understands risks, and is courageous to drive the change, then this position was made for you! You??ll spend time on the following:    You will proactively seek out ways to avoid common software-testing problems such as test case duplication, a ky tests, and maintainability    You will pair including but not limited to devs, business analysts, engineering managers and operations to identify gaps & improve team eciencies    Strive for quality to be baked-in and aspire to shift quality to the left    Extend your passion for quality assurance practices to enable the engineering teams & coach to adopt a testing mindset    Spike, Compare and choose the right tools and eco-system for scalable and fast test automation    Drive the creation of reliable automated testing frameworks with strong reporting capabilities that ensures simple, eective analysis of failures for your team to use    Capture metrics to measure the quality and make decisions that improve quality The outcomes of this role include:    The team is able to get faster feedback for changes and express condence in safety-net    The team is able to measure and gain insights into improvements to the product quality    Team expresses increased condence and trust in test assets You??ll also spend time on the following:    Storytelling and socializing the tech and engineering success stories across TestVagrant    Take initiative and participate in others, that move organization forward, aligning with tech and engineering  rst culture    Mentor the SDETs to grow in the direction of Sr. SDETs To achieve the above, most of the following experience is a must:    4+ years of relevant experience as SDET    You have strong coding skills in JavaScript/TypeScript. Deep understanding of WebdriverIO or equivalent. Knowledge of developing AngularJS applications is a plus.    You have designed, developed, and evolved scalable test automation frameworks from scratch    You have contributed to various layers of the test pyramid    You have prociency in automation tools and techniques, including but not limited to Web, Mobile, and APIs    You have worked as a Quality Analyst as part of a distributed engineering team, pairing with Devs, Business Analysts, and Infra teams    You have championed the quality domain and are procient in functional, non-functional, and exploratory testing techniques    You have the ability to pick up new tech stack and contribute to developing test assets To know more about TestVagrant visit the below  websites. Company website -https://testvagrant.com/? Linkedin - https://in.linkedin.com/company/testvagrant-technologies

column2: Job Description for QA Automation Engineer Requirements 1.Proven experience as a QAAutomation Tester or similar role.  2.Strong knowledge of software testing principles, methodologies, and best practices.  3.Proficiency in test automation frameworks and tools such as RestAssured, Selenium, Appium,  Cucumber, JUnit, or TestNG. 4.Strong understanding of using different API & UI automation tools, Element locators, Assertions,  and reporting techniques. 5.Hands-on experience with programming languages like Java, Python, or JavaScript.  6.Understanding web technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) and web services (RESTful APIs).  7.Experience with version control systems (Git, SVN) and continuous integration tools (Jenkins,  Bamboo).  8.Experience in JS-based frameworks like - Cypress, Playwright, and WebDriverIO would be an  advantage.  9.Experience with mobile app testing would be preferred.  10.Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies and the ability to work in an Agile development  environment.  11.Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.  12.Strong attention to detail and ability to work independently as well as in a team.  13.Good communication skills to effectively collaborate with team members and stakeholders.  Responsibilities-  Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers and products, and ensure high-quality software delivery.  Design, develop, and maintain test cases, automated test frameworks, and scripts using industry. standard tools and frameworks.  Perform thorough testing of software applications, including functional, regression, integration, and  performance testing.  Identify, document, and track software defects, working closely with developers to resolve issues  promptly.  Analyze test results and provide comprehensive reports to stakeholders, highlighting any quality or  performance concerns.  Collaborate with the development team to integrate automated tests into the continuous integration  and delivery pipelines.  Stay updated with the latest industry trends and advancements in test automation methodologies and  tools, and apply them to improve the QA process.  Develop and maintain automated test scripts using Selenium and RestAssured test frameworks and  tools.  Execute automated test scripts using CI/CD to validate software functionality, performance, and  reliability.  Identify and report software defects, issues, and potential risks.  Continuously improve test automation frameworks(Data-driven, Keyword-driven & Hybrid) and  processes to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.

column2: There is a requirement of   Quality Manager Position at   Cohera Automation Pvt LTD, KIADB Aerospace Park, 31&32, Batramarenahalli, Bengaluru, Karnataka 562110. The following are the requirements to apply. The candidate should have a minimum of 4   5   year   Aerospace industrial experience.   Roles & Responsibility 1. **Quality Control Oversight:** Implementing and managing quality control processes throughout the manufacturing lifecycle to ensure products meet specified standards.   2. **Standard Development:** Developing and maintaining quality standards and procedures in compliance with industry regulations and customer requirements.   3. **Inspection Management:** Overseeing product inspections and audits to identify defects, deviations, or areas for improvement in the manufacturing process.   4. **Data Analysis:** Analyzing data related to product quality, defect rates, and customer feedback to identify trends and areas for improvement.   5. **Continuous Improvement:** Initiating and leading continuous improvement initiatives to enhance manufacturing processes and eliminate inefficiencies or defects.   6. **Regulatory Compliance:** Ensuring that the manufacturing processes adhere to relevant industry regulations, quality standards, and certifications.   7. **Supplier Quality Management:** Collaborating with suppliers to ensure the quality of incoming materials and components, and addressing any quality issues in the supply chain.   8. **Training and Development:** Providing training to manufacturing staff on quality standards, procedures, and best practices to maintain a high level of quality awareness.   9. **Root Cause Analysis:** Conducting thorough investigations into quality issues, identifying root causes, and implementing corrective and preventive actions.   10. **Customer Satisfaction:** Monitoring and addressing customer feedback and complaints related to product quality, and implementing measures to enhance customer satisfaction.   11. **Documentation and Reporting:** Maintaining accurate records of quality control activities, preparing reports for management, and participating in management reviews.   12. **Cross-Functional Collaboration:** Collaborating with other departments such as production, engineering, and logistics to ensure a holistic approach to quality management.   13. **Risk Assessment:** Conducting risk assessments to identify potential quality issues and implementing measures to mitigate risks.   14. **Quality Assurance Systems:** Implementing and maintaining robust quality assurance systems to monitor and control all aspects of the manufacturing process.   15. **Leadership and Communication:** Providing leadership in the quality function, communicating quality objectives, and fostering a culture of quality throughout the organization.   16. **Preparation:** Prepare the manufacturing facility and personnel for the external audit by reviewing relevant documentation, conducting internal audits, and ensuring that all necessary records are up-to-date.     17. **Documentation Review:** Provide auditors with access to relevant quality documentation, procedures, and records. Ensure that all required documentation is organized and readily available for inspection.   18. **Process Verification:** Collaborate with auditors to verify the effectiveness and adherence to established quality processes and procedures within the manufacturing environment.   19. **Compliance Assurance:** Ensure that the manufacturing processes comply with industry standards, regulatory requirements, and any specific standards requested by the external auditors.   20. **Audit Coordination:** Act as the main point of contact between the manufacturing team and external auditors, coordinating audit activities and facilitating communication throughout the audit process.   21. **Corrective Action Implementation:** Address any non-conformities or findings identified during the audit by implementing corrective actions and preventive measures. Ensure that corrective actions are documented and communicated effectively.   22. **Continuous Improvement:** Use audit findings as opportunities for continuous improvement, providing insights and recommendations for enhancing the overall quality management system.   23. **Regulatory Compliance:** Confirm that the manufacturing processes align with regulatory requirements, and assist auditors in understanding how the organization complies with applicable laws and standards.   24. **Supplier Audits:** If applicable, support and participate in audits of key suppliers to ensure the quality of incoming materials and components.   25 **Audit Report Review:** Collaborate with auditors during the preparation of the audit report, addressing any concerns or providing additional information to clarify the manufacturing processes.   26. **Follow-up Actions:** Monitor and ensure timely implementation of corrective actions recommended by auditors, and provide evidence of their effectiveness.   27. **Training and Awareness:** Confirm that all relevant personnel are trained and aware of their roles in supporting the external audit process.   28. **Communication with Management:** Communicate audit findings, outcomes, and areas for improvement to top management, providing a comprehensive overview of the audit results. 30 ** AS9100 Standards Knowledge??policies, processes, documented procedures, and records that define how the company will operate in order to provide products and services to customers . To Coordinate for Internal / External AS9100 audits to verify conformance when the actual activities match the planned activities; & if processes are not happening as planned, this is identified & to update the Top management .       Eligible Candidates can contact: Mr Sampath : +91 99451 11005 HR Manager, Cohera Automation PVT LTD.( Defence & Aerospace)

column2: We are seeking an experienced Software Quality Engineering Lead with hands on experience to oversee our quality assurance efforts and lead a team of software quality engineers. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in software testing and quality assurance, as well as proven leadership skills to guide and mentor team members. As a Software Quality Engineering Lead, you will be responsible for developing test automation framframeworksewor, testing strategies, implementing best practices, and ensuring the delivery of high-quality software products. Responsibilities: Lead and mentor a team of software quality engineers, providing guidance and support to ensure their professional growth and development. Develop and implement comprehensive testing strategies to ensure software products' quality, reliability, and performance. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define testing requirements, prioritize testing efforts, and identify areas for improvement. Establish and maintain testing processes, standards, and best practices to streamline testing activities and improve efficiency. Design and execute manual and automated test cases, including functional testing, regression testing, performance testing, and security testing. Monitor and analyze test results, identify trends and patterns, and provide insights and recommendations to improve software quality. Manage test environments and test data, ensuring they are up-to-date and relevant for testing activities. Coordinate with software development teams to prioritize and resolve defects, track issues to resolution, and ensure timely delivery of bug fixes. Stay current with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in software testing and quality assurance. Requirements: Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field with  7+ years of experience in software quality assurance or testing role, with 2 years in lead position.  Strong leadership and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively communicate, collaborate, and influence stakeholders at all levels. Deep understanding of software testing methodologies, tools, and best practices. Hands on experience with test automation tools and frameworks such as Selenium, JMeter or similar. Proficiency in programming languages such as Java, Python. Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and effectively manage competing priorities. Experience with continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines. Knowledge of Agile/Scrum methodologies. Familiarity with cloud computing platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform.

column1: Officer - Regulatory Affairs/In Process Quality Assurance
column2: Developing, implementing and managing audits and      maintaining quality systems to support commercial, environmental and      developmental activities for a pharmaceutical company with sales in      multiple countries. Responsible for giving Company presentations      & conduct all regulated reviews & fresh audits.  Preparing of Audit & non confirmatory reports      & correspondence with foreign regulated parties & auditors      for any query related to business matters. Responsible for conducting & coordinating      Self Inspections & verification of the CAPA of the same. Coordinating & handling Internal Plant Audits      for preparedness of upcoming Audits. Responsible for imparting trainings on GMP      guidelines, Change controls, personal hygiene and all other related      areas of general topics of plant. Maintaining highest level of Data Integrity in      QA/QC, Production, and Engineering in general. Ensuring Online Documentation, Process      Validation, and Issuance of BMR/BPR & ensuring online completion of      BMRs. Overseeing Batch release activities, including      review & preparation of BMR, BPR, SOP and all other documents. Responsible for maintaining all QA documentations      (like USR, FRS, FAT, SAT, DQ, IQ, OQ, PQ) of various instruments      & equipments. Preparing, maintaining & reviewing and      approval of SOPs of QA & all other departments as per regulated      guidelines. Overseeing Deviations, batch failure      investigation, Change control (minor and moderate), OOS (Out Of      Specifications), Product recall & market complaints. Responsible for review of technology transfer      documents, monitoring of stability study/program & approval of stability      protocols, checking of process validation, cleaning validation and      reports of the same. Handling of OOT (Out of Trend) &      Incident Reporting. Ensuring Annual Product Quality Review (APQR) of      the Products and Risk Assessment of products & processes.  Ensuring regular monitoring of the Good      Laboratory Practices (GLP) in QC department (e.g. Chemical, Instruments      and Micro section). Monitoring the control sample and reports.  Ensuring daily 3 hours Shop floor visit and      ensuring quality of process and products. Monitoring GMP Regulation in the surrounding      areas of the plant premises (Water, Utility, etc. Smooth operation of all QA activities &      functions on day to day basis. Compliance of all documentation related to      Standard Operating Procedures (S.O.P.) and Standard Operating Instructions      of all Departments on day-to-day basis to ensure no backlog and no manipulations      at any stage. Day-to-day review of Batch Manufacturing Records      (B.M.Rs) is online and there are no entries made retrospectively. In any local Food and Drugs Authority (FDA) or      International Audit you will be solely responsible for document audit and      actually facing the audit with respect to documentation. Ulmost Data Integrity is our Organizational priority. You undertake to create genuine Data & protecting and preserving them in a systematic manner. To start with, you will be responsible for quality of our products, safety of our property, people and yourself. Checking the correctness of dispensing.  Checking of fill-weight and shell weight during      Encapsulation. Checking the Temperature and Relative Humidity in      the critical areas. Checking the activities in Capsule Printing to      ensure proper printing. Checking the activities of Carton Printing and      ensure proper Carton printing. Checking the Capsules which are already visually      inspected and ensure that they are satisfactory. Checking the correctness of correctness. The management of the Company attaches great and      significant importance to conservation of resources and preservation of      our Environment. Thus it would be prerequisite that you understand      environment needs of our Organization and concerned Statutory Authorities. Understanding the process of Manufacturing &      implement Good Manufacturing Practices.  Ensuring All Documentation as per current Good      Manufacturing Practices (cGMP) Norms. Ensuring the process of Line Clearance and In      Process Quality Assurance (IPQA).  Responsible for conducting & coordinating      Self Inspections & Verification of the Corrective Action &      Preventive Action (CAPA) of the same & also coordinating for      Internal Plant Audits. Preparing BMR/BPR, handling & maintaining the      QA Documentation.   Ensuring Online Documentation, Process      Validation, Issuance of BMR/BPR & ensuring In Time Completion of      BMRs/BPRs.

column2: Greetings!  One of the pioneering companies in India, established in 1969, manufacturing control valves at Thane, (near Mumbai).  Job Designation: Quality Assurance Manager Location: Thane Job Summary Overseeing and managing all aspects of quality control and assurance Ensure that products meet or exceed industry standards, customer specifications, and regulatory requirements while maintaining a high level of process efficiency and consistency. Accountabilities 	Develop and implement stage-wise quality control processes, procedures, and standards for the manufacturing of control valves. 	Establish and maintain a comprehensive quality management system (QMS) in compliance with industry standards and regulations. 	Define and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to track and report on quality metrics. 	Conduct regular inspections and audits of production processes to identify areas for improvement and compliance with quality standards. 	Conduct supplier audits and evaluations to assess and improve the quality of incoming materials. 	Oversee product testing and validation processes, including functional, performance, and reliability testing. 	Ensure that testing equipment and procedures are calibrated and maintained properly. 	Maintain accurate and complete records of quality control activities, test results, and non-conformities. 	Generate reports and documentation necessary for compliance and continuous improvement. 	Provide training and guidance to production and quality control staff on quality standards and procedures. 	Poster a culture of quality and continuous improvement throughout the organization. 	Investigate and resolve customer complaints, non-conformities, and quality issues by conducting root cause analysis. 	Develop and implement corrective and preventive action plans. 	Lead or participate in cross-functional teams for continuous improvement projects. Desired Profile 	Full time Engineering Degree Mechanical, Industrial, Quality). 	7-10 years of experience in quality assurance and control within a manufacturing environment, preferably in control valve manufacturing. 	Strong knowledge of quality management systems (e.g., ISO 9001). 	Familiarity with relevant industry standards and specifications. 	Strong communication and leadership abilities.

column2: Key Responsibilities: Conduct thorough inspections of home textile products at various stages of production, including raw materials, in-process items, and finished goods. Inspect fabrics, seams, stitching, prints, patterns, and other relevant aspects to ensure adherence to quality standards and specifications. Identify defects, irregularities, or inconsistencies in materials or workmanship, and accurately document findings. Collaborate with production teams to address and resolve quality issues promptly, ensuring minimal impact on production schedules. Communicate quality standards and requirements clearly to production staff, providing guidance and training as needed to maintain consistency. Monitor and enforce adherence to quality control procedures, including proper handling, storage, and packaging of products. Participate in the development and implementation of quality improvement initiatives, contributing ideas and feedback to enhance processes. Maintain detailed records and documentation of inspection results, including photos, measurements, and descriptions of defects. Assist in conducting root cause analysis for quality issues, identifying underlying causes and implementing corrective actions to prevent recurrence. Stay updated on industry trends, regulations, and best practices related to home textiles quality control, and incorporate relevant knowledge into daily operations. Qualifications: High school diploma or equivalent; additional education or training in textiles, quality assurance, or a related field is a plus. Proven experience in quality control or inspection within the textiles industry, preferably in home textiles. Strong attention to detail and ability to perform meticulous inspections consistently. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate quality standards and provide constructive feedback. Solid understanding of textile materials, construction methods, and manufacturing processes. Familiarity with quality control tools and techniques, such as visual inspection, measurements, and statistical analysis. Ability to work independently with minimal supervision, as well as collaboratively within a team environment. Proficiency in using computers and software applications for documentation and record-keeping. Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities and work schedules as needed. Commitment to upholding high standards of quality and integrity in all aspects of work. Preferred Skills: Previous experience working with home textile products such as bedding, towels, and curtains. Certification in quality control or quality assurance. Knowledge of relevant industry regulations and standards, such as ISO 9001. Problem-solving skills and ability to analyse complex issues to identify solutions. Familiarity with continuous improvement methodologies such as Six Sigma or Lean Manufacturing.

column2: Role & responsibilities   Develop and implement quality assurance programs and procedures to meet industry       standards and regulatory requirements. Establish quality control measures for incoming raw materials, production       processes, and finished products. Conduct regular audits and assessments to monitor adherence to quality standards       and identify areas for improvement. Perform inspections and quality checks at various stages of the food production       process, including raw material intake, processing, packaging, and       distribution. Utilize testing equipment and analytical methods to assess product quality,       safety, and shelf-life parameters. Document inspection results, track trends, and communicate findings to relevant       stakeholders for corrective actions. Stay updated with food safety regulations, standards, and guidelines       applicable to the industry. Prepare and maintain documentation related to regulatory audits, certifications,       and quality assurance reports. Implement corrective and preventive actions (CAPAs) to address non-conformities,       deviations, and customer complaints. Conduct root cause analysis and risk assessments to mitigate quality-related       risks and enhance product quality. Preferred candidate profile     B. Tech in Food Technology is mandatory. Proven experience in quality assurance or quality control roles within the food      industry, with knowledge of food safety regulations and quality management      systems. Familiarity with food processing techniques, microbiology, food chemistry, and sensory      evaluation. Strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and problem-solving abilities. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with      internal teams and external stakeholders. Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and manage multiple projects in a      fast-paced environment. Interested candidates can share your profiles to  hemanth.c@namdhariseeds.com

column2: The SrOfficer- Quality Assurance is    responsible to ensure that customer and regulatory requirements have been met by inspecting products and review of documentation throughout all aspects of the production process      Also to ensure compliance with all applicable standards and regulations, Good Manufacturing Practices (cGMPs), and Good Documentation Practices (GDPs)      Provide Event and Complaint investigation support to other team members                           What we re looking for            Education:      Bachelors degree in Chemistry, Biology, or related field. Masters degree is a plus.          Experience:      Minimum 5 years of experience working in quality assurance or related role within the pharmaceutical, biotechnology, or chemical industries.        Knowledge of ISO 9001, ISO 13485, 21 CFR 820, 21 CFR 11, ISO 17025, or EXCiPACT standard is preferred      Demonstrated experience or knowledge in conducting root cause analysis as it relates to non conforming material investigations      Knowledge and experience utilizing Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel, and Access, or equivalent software packages              How you will thrive and create an impact            Investigation - Performs real-time risk assessment and sufficiently controls suspected non conforming finished products, raw materials, and/or packaging components.          Provides Event and Complaint investigation support to other team members. Provides oversight to ensure appropriate segregation of non-conforming material and resolution to product to resolve customer product pipeline.            Validation - Supports equipment and product validation activities. Utilizes validation knowledge when assessing risk associated with internal events.            Training - Provides initial training to new QA Inspectors; assists other departments with necessary training that pertains to functional aspects of the Quality Management System (QMS). Develops, maintains, and routinely evaluates on-boarding requirements for QA Inspectors.    Audits -          Leads Internal QMS Audits, conducts effectiveness audits, supports external customer and regulatory audits, and manages the Line of Sight / On the Floor Audit Program. Manages quality compliance on the production floor and is responsible for the communication and resolution within production areas with operations management.            Scheduling - Coordinates daily and weekend QA coverage to support production activities.            Batch Record Review and Release - Assists with the review and release of batch records as needed to support on-time delivery; ensures GDP compliance.            Provides coaching and mentorship to QA Inspectors, and is the initial point of contact for production issue resolution.            Complies with company policies, procedures, work instructions, and training requirements focusing on customer service, production, and quality.            Keeps customer interests and regulatory requirements in mind, ensures customer needs are met by reviewing order requirements, customer documentation requirements, proper filling and assembly requirements, and, where needed, ensures other technicians understand and follow documented VWR procedures and GMP requirements.            Ensures customer requirements are met.            Verifies adherence to policies, procedures, and work instructions.            Reviews production documentation for accuracy, completeness, and GDP compliance.    Assists in correcting order issues and ensures actions that are taken are appropriate.            Communicates issues / concerns to area owner and direct manager.    Ensures actions taken to resolve production issues and concerns are effective.            Ensures that the area is in a state of audit readiness at all times.            Performs inspection tasks by following established work instructions and procedures, by using required tools and methods and; when applicable, equipment, to determine acceptability of product, components, and documentation.            Performs pre-fill, in-process, and final inspections with the aid of documented work instructions and inspection information as required.            Stops production when a non-conformance (NCM) is observed and follows appropriate NCM procedures.            Documents non-conformances following applicable AMRESCO / VWR Solon procedures and work instructions.    Documents and trends any quality production issues discovered during the course of inspection duties.            Ensures cleanliness of work areas during the inspection processes.    Initiates change requests to order documentation (bills of material) to resolve future production issues when necessary.            Assists in the development and implementation of corrective and / or preventive actions.            Utilizes problem solving tools such as 5M+E, 5 Why s, or other root cause analysis tools / methods to identify and permanently resolve issues.            Adheres to AMRESCO / VWR Solon s QMS and VWR Policies, where applicable.    Walks the floor to observe, train, and facilitate / support change.            Performs other duties as assigned.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.   6. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.   7. Attention to detail and accuracy in work.   8. Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.   9. Certification in quality engineering or related field (e.g., Certified Quality Engineer) is a plus.                                     ?                                                                                 Duties & Responsibilities                                     ?                                     1.Conduct thorough inspections of incoming materials and components to ensure they meet quality standards and specifications.     2.Perform quality tests and measurements on incoming materials using appropriate equipment and procedures. This may include dimensional inspections, visual inspections, material testing, and functional testing.     3.Implement quality assurance processes and procedures for incoming materials, including sampling plans, inspection criteria, and acceptance criteria.     4.Identify quality issues, defects, or non-conformities in incoming materials and components. Document and report any discrepancies to relevant stakeholders.     5.Investigate root causes of quality issues and non-conformities. Work with suppliers to address root causes and implement corrective actions to prevent recurrence.     6.Collaborate with suppliers to improve product quality and resolve quality-related issues. Provide feedback to suppliers on quality performance and work together to implement improvements.     7.Maintain accurate records of incoming inspection results, test data, and quality issues. Ensure that all documentation meets regulatory requirements and quality standards.     8.Identify opportunities for process improvement and quality enhancement in the receipt inspection process. Implement continuous improvement initiatives to optimize quality control procedures.     9.Provide training and guidance to receiving personnel on quality inspection techniques, procedures, and standards. column2: Job description Definition: Ensures incoming parts from supply chain companies and internally produced components/vehicles meet the quality standards and systems required. Ensure incoming materials meet required quality standards. Responsible for identifying and raising quality issues and for speedily resolving them to ensure zero impact to the customer. Support new product introductions to ensure the robustness of product builds. Work in a team environment to develop and implement best practices that emphasize defect prevention, reduction in variation and waste and provide for continuous improvements in meeting all customer requirements. Manage the customer specific requirements and offer technical support. Responsible for multiple highly complex major projects requiring innovative original solutions where results are key to successful completion of major projects. Work mostly independently with minimal supervision and work is reviewed at project milestones and/or on completion by Senior Management. Key Responsibilities: General and Task Management Manage all quality-related issues within the manufacturing team (e.g. internal, supplier, customer and customer warranty) Identify root cause and instigate permanent corrective actions for product quality issues Work with internal and external stakeholders to resolve quality issues that arise as quickly and efficiently as possible to prevent compromising quality and safety standards Carry out product and process auditing Ensure control plans and associated documentation are implemented effectively and maintained Monitor and report on quality-related key performance indicators including scrap monitoring, rework levels, parts per million (PPM) figures Stop production in the event of manufacture of unacceptable goods/processes Ensure compliance and assist with adherence to the Quality Management system (ISO9001) Write product test procedures Undertake special projects as required Contribute to continuous improvement activities Quality control of work by appropriate reviews Support and lead process improvement activities Write reports and present progress at project meetings and to stakeholders Achieve goals within budget Conduct benchmarking studies to determine best practices/designs and future trends Plan projects or subtasks so they may be tracked and presented Attend various meetings and action/communicate instructions Produce written reports and make presentations Undertake continuous training and development Perform root cause analysis and resolve problems Independently determine approach and assigned tasks People Management: Lead and/or support groups of technicians and engineers Provide guidance to other team members Train both team and broader organization members Relationship Management: Support regular inspection meetings with representatives from appropriate departments to establish an action plan for improving build quality Communicate efficiently throughout the shop floor and with own and customers management Liaise and communicate with other departments, customers, suppliers and other service providers Self management: Comply with the Health, Safety and Environmental Policies Assertive, resilient and welcomes change Engages interest and participation of others and has a collaborative approach to working with others Proactively contributes to the team Is self aware Is resilient, optimistic and open to change Shows moral courage, openness and honesty in all dealings Skills & Attributes: Exercise substantial initiative/judgment in work methods and interpreting goals Work independently and is reviewed infrequently with minimal supervision Self-supervising within the guidance and expectations of divisional management Knowledge of quality systems and measurement Strong knowledge of Advanced Product Quality Planning (APQP), Production Part Approval Process (PPAP), Failure Mode and Effect Analysis (FMEA) Lean Manufacturing knowledge Knowledge of ISO9001 & understanding of ISO14001 and Health and Safety practices Understanding of engineering drawings and manufacturing processes Ability to work in a diverse and dynamic environment Planning and prioritizing activities Good communication and interpersonal skills Negotiation skills Ability to present data effectively Problem-solving skills Team working skills Analytical skills Understanding of cost and financial impacts Qualification and experience: B tech manufacturing/engineering degree preferred with minimum 2 years experience or Diploma with 4-5 years of experience Previous experience in a high volume manufacturing environment, preferably automotive Experience of working in Quality Assurance Six Sigma/Lean Manufacturing skills Experience of dealing with customers and suppliers Perks include Industry competitive salary packages with benefits Exposure working with some of the best minds in the industry. A positive work atmosphere that encourages collaboration and holistic development We provide a comprehensive insurance cover for you and your family.

column2: Skill required:Quality analysis - Quality Management  Designation:Management Level - Associate Manager  Job Location:Hyderabad  Qualifications:Any Graduation  Years of Experience:10 to 14 years  What would you do? "You will be aligned with our Quality vertical and help us manage risk in service delivery to an acceptable level as defined by the Accenture client and increase the level of awareness of and in compliance with policy and process related matters. You will be working with the quality analysis team which works on industry standard quality tools and frameworks. In Quality Management, you will be overseeing all activities and tasks needed to maintain a desired level of excellence. This includes the determination of a quality policy, creating and implementing quality planning and assurance, quality control, and quality improvement."  What are we looking for? " Quality Assurance (QA)  Quality Management  Training and Performance Support  Ability to manage multiple stakeholders  Collaboration and interpersonal skills  Problem-solving skills  Risk management  Training Environment Strategy  Training Needs Analysis" Roles and Responsibilities " In this role you are required to do analysis and solving of moderately complex problems  Typically creates new solutions, leveraging and, where needed, adapting existing methods and procedures  The person requires understanding of the strategic direction set by senior management as it relates to team goals  Primary upward interaction is with direct supervisor or team leads  Generally interacts with peers and/or management levels at a client and/or within Accenture  The person should require minimal guidance when determining methods and procedures on new assignments  Decisions often impact the team in which they reside and occasionally impact other teams  Individual would manage medium-small sized teams and/or work efforts (if in an individual contributor role) at a client or within Accenture  Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts"

column2: Interested Candidates  can WhatsApp details to -  7200384396  We are seeking a dedicated and detail-oriented Quality Executive to join our team and support our commitment to delivering high-quality healthcare services. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 1 year of experience in NABH (National Accreditation Board for Hospitals & Healthcare Providers) audit and a strong understanding of quality management systems in a hospital setting.  Role & responsibilities     NABH Compliance:  Assist in maintaining compliance with NABH standards and requirements by implementing and monitoring quality management systems across the hospital. Quality Audits:  Conduct internal quality audits to assess compliance with NABH standards, identify areas for improvement, and develop action plans to address any deficiencies. Documentation:  Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation related to quality management systems, including policies, procedures, protocols, and records of quality audits and corrective actions. Training and Education:  Provide training and education to hospital staff on quality management principles, NABH standards, and best practices for ensuring patient safety and quality of care. Quality Improvement Projects:  Collaborate with department heads and staff to identify opportunities for quality improvement initiatives, develop project plans, and monitor progress towards achieving quality improvement goals. Patient Feedback:  Collect and analyze patient feedback data to identify trends, issues, and opportunities for enhancing the patient experience and improving service delivery. Risk Management:  Assist in the identification and management of risks related to patient safety, quality of care, and regulatory compliance, and participate in root cause analysis and adverse event investigations as needed. Performance Metrics:  Develop and maintain performance metrics and dashboards to track key quality indicators, monitor performance against targets, and communicate results to hospital leadership. Quality Committee Support:  Provide administrative support to the hospital's Quality Improvement Committee, including scheduling meetings, preparing agendas, documenting minutes, and following up on action items. Continuous Improvement:  Stay abreast of industry trends, best practices, and regulatory changes related to quality management in healthcare, and recommend updates and improvements to quality management systems as needed.    Preferred candidate profile     Bachelor's degree in healthcare administration, nursing, or a related field. Minimum of 1 year of experience in quality management or quality assurance in a hospital setting, with specific experience in NABH audit. Strong understanding of NABH standards and requirements, as well as other relevant quality management frameworks (e.g., ISO 9001). Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills, with meticulous attention to detail. Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and experience with quality management software preferred. Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment. Commitment to upholding the highest standards of patient safety, quality of care, and regulatory compliance.

column2: Dr Reddys Laboratories Ltd is looking for Quality Control Associate to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     A Quality Control Professional is responsible for ensuring that products or services meet established quality standards and customer expectations     They play a vital role in maintaining and improving the quality of products, processes, and systems within an organization     The specific job duties may vary depending on the industry and organization, but here are some common responsibilities:Quality Assurance: Develop and implement quality control procedures and policies to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and industry standards     This involves creating quality control plans, conducting risk assessments, and establishing quality metrics     Inspection and Testing: Perform inspections, tests, and sampling procedures to assess product quality and identify any deviations from standards     This may include visual inspections, measurements, functional testing, and other specialized techniques     They analyze test data and generate reports to document findings     Process Improvement: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify areas for process improvement     They participate in root cause analysis investigations to determine the underlying causes of quality issues and implement corrective actions to prevent reoccurrence     Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate and detailed records of quality control activities, test results, and other relevant documentation     They prepare quality reports, summaries, and presentations to communicate findings to management and stakeholders     Training and Compliance: Provide training and guidance to employees on quality control procedures, standards, and best practices     They ensure that employees understand and follow quality guidelines and regulatory requirements     They also monitor compliance with internal quality policies and external regulations     Supplier Quality Management: Collaborate with suppliers to establish quality requirements and monitor supplier performance     They conduct supplier audits, evaluate incoming materials or components, and address any quality issues with suppliers     Continuous Improvement: Stay updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and regulatory changes related to quality control     They actively seek opportunities for continuous improvement and implement new methodologies or tools to enhance quality control processes     Skills and Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as engineering, quality management, or a related discipline     A master's degree may be preferred for higher-level positions     Strong knowledge of quality control principles, methodologies, and tools (e g, Six Sigma, Statistical Process Control, Lean Manufacturing)     Familiarity with quality management systems (e g, ISO 9001) and regulatory requirements applicable to the industry     Experience in performing inspections, tests, and data analysis using various quality tools and techniques     Excellent attention to detail and analytical skills to identify trends, patterns, and quality issues     Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities to address quality concerns and implement effective solutions     Effective communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams, suppliers, and customers     Proficiency in using quality control software, data analysis tools, and computer applications     Knowledge of relevant industry standards and best practices     Familiarity with auditing principles and practices     Ability to work independently and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment

column2: Job Title: Quality Control Executive Overview: As a Quality Control Executive, you will play a critical role in ensuring that our products meet the highest standards of quality and regulatory compliance. You will be responsible for implementing and maintaining quality assurance processes, conducting inspections, and analyzing data to identify areas for improvement. Your attention to detail and commitment to excellence will contribute to the overall success and reputation of our organization. Responsibilities: Implement Quality Control Processes:  Develop and implement quality control procedures to ensure compliance with industry standards and regulatory requirements. Conduct Inspections and Audits:  Perform regular inspections of products, materials, and processes to identify deviations from quality standards. Conduct internal audits to assess compliance with quality management systems. Data Analysis:  Analyze quality data and trends to identify areas for improvement. Use statistical methods and tools to assess process capability and product quality. Documentation and Reporting:  Maintain accurate records of quality control activities, including inspection results, corrective actions, and quality metrics. Prepare reports summarizing findings and recommendations for management review. Collaboration:  Work closely with cross-functional teams, including production, engineering, and supply chain, to resolve quality issues and implement corrective actions. Training and Education:  Provide training and guidance to employees on quality control procedures, standards, and best practices. Promote a culture of quality and continuous improvement throughout the organization. Supplier Management:  Evaluate and qualify suppliers based on their quality management systems and performance. Monitor supplier quality and address any issues or non-conformances. Requirements: Education:  Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as engineering, quality management, or a related discipline.  Experience:  Minimum of 1 year of experience in quality control or assurance roles, preferably in a manufacturing or regulated industry. Experience with ISO standards and regulatory requirements (e.g., FDA, ISO 9001) is highly desirable. Technical Skills:  Proficient in MS Office, GMAIL all tools, Familiarity with quality management Protocols is an advantage. Analytical Skills:  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data and draw actionable insights. Communication Skills:  Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to effectively communicate quality-related information to diverse audiences. Team Player:  Collaborative attitude with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams and build positive relationships with stakeholders at all levels of the organization. Join our team and contribute to our organization's success by ensuring our products' quality and reliability. We are committed to excellence and continuous improvement and welcome individuals who share our passion for quality and innovation. Apply now to become a part of our dynamic team!

column2: Main purpose of this role is to ensure process validation activities at the contract manufacturer has been carried out as per current GMP standards and best industry practices in line with Marketing Authorisations (MA).                       What You ll Do:                         Maintain and lead the activities for the planning and implementation of any analytical and / or process validation master plans for all MA s held by the company.                             Review and approve process validation protocols and reports for upcoming projects (Development / Technology Transfer / Product Lifecycle Management changes) and ensure SOP is followed throughout the process.                             Perform detailed validation gap analysis of process and analytical method validations across the range of products under company portfolio as per relevant SOP.                             Highlight any discrepancies / gaps identified in the existing validation, risk assess the identified gaps and propose and lead appropriate remediation activities by liaising with internal / external business partners to close the actions on time.                             Support delivery of specific projects as Quality representative for site transfers, API dual sourcing, reformulation and process improvements.                             Based on Formulation / production experience, able to take decisions for any issues to be resolved during process validation batches, no. of batches to be taken based on product know-how and type of change.                             Should be able to define CPP / CQAs based on formulation knowledge and accordingly review the process validation protocols and reports.                             Should be able to review the analytical methods and method validation documents and perform the gap analysis against latest ICH guidelines and pharmacopoeia requirements.                             Maintain inventories for all existing process and analytical validation protocols and reports and ensure SOP is followed throughout the process.                             Support change control process with impact analysis from validation perspective and suggest tasks as required.                             Support QP s; when required, in their batch release for reviewing key validation documents.                             To ensure effective communication is maintained with internal customers & external manufacturers.                             To review the existing procedures and do the necessary improvements needed in Validation Summary document process.                             To provide the support in drafting the risk assessments for the issues logged in the risk register                             To provide the support in the preparation of monthly metrics and present on behalf of the team wherever needed.                              Provide support during inspection by competent authorities and / or during the customer audits.                               About You                               We are looking for highly motivated individuals who are passionate about making a meaningful difference to patients lives.                          For this role, you will also have the following:                             Qualifications:                         Must have significant experience in analytical method development and validation for regulated and unregulated markets.                     Sound working knowledge of all relevant GMP regulations.                     Knowledge, Skills & Experience:                     Significant experience of working in an equivalent role (Formulation development / QA / Production / Regulatory CMC) within a pharmaceutical company handling the            following     :            Process validation                 Analytical validation                 Microbiological / Sterile process                 Manufacturing of batches                         Process validation                     Analytical validation                     Microbiological / Sterile process                     Manufacturing of batches                     Good understanding of analytical techniques and relevant pharmacopeia requirements                     Experience in management of third-party contractors (CMOs/Contract testing labs)                     Knowledge of electronic document management systems and their use in a regulated environment.                     Good knowledge of validation guidelines including ICH Q2 and Annex 15 of EU GMP Guide.                     Knowledge of technical aspects of product manufacture including quality control and compliance.                     Ability to check, analyze and investigate scientific data and information provided in the registered document.                     Proactive nature with solution finding skills and abilities.                     Excellent interpersonal, communication, organizational skills, and attention to detail.                     A positive and can-do approach, biased towards finding solutions and embracing change.                     Inspired by our values of entrepreneurship, speed and integrity.                     Learning agility and scalability , with a desire to continuously improve and develop as ADVANZ grows.                     Work collaboratively across all business functions with an open, honest, and respectful cooperation.                     Ability to have fun and thrive in a growing, unique, and inclusive work environment.
